pr_title: Add custom registry type support to DeferredRegister.

timeline.message: Add custom registry type support to DeferredRegister.

timeline.author: Cyborgmas
Cyborgmas

replies.bodyText: In java it isn't @see THING it is {@link THING}
replies.author: pupnewfster

replies.bodyText: Hmm it worked though. Gave me a link to the function.
replies.author: Cyborgmas

replies.bodyText: Ah turns out java also has a @see I just have never actually seen it used before so didn't realize it was actually a thing.
replies.author: pupnewfster

timeline.author: Cyborgmas

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * See the example usage.
          
          
            
                 * See the example usage.
          
          
            
                 *
          
          
            
                 * If using this for a custom registry, creates the the registry for you in {@link #createRegistry} using the {@link RegistryEvent.NewRegistry} event
          
          
            
                 * If no {@link #registryFactory} was provided, listens to the NewRegistry event on {@link EventPriority.LOWEST} to check if the registry was properly created.
timeline.author: Cyborgmas

timeline.bodyText: As a reference to Class<T> superType is now stored in DeferredRegister would it make more sense to just compare event.getGenericType() to that rather than querying the registry for it?
timeline.author: pupnewfster

replies.bodyText:
No, because the intent is to not have superType be in here/definitive.
As one of the intentions is to be able to be used as a soft link.
By referring to the registry by name or some other method.
replies.author: LexManos
